Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are several events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. However, providing a comprehensive list of 10 such events might be too extensive for this response. Instead, I'll mention some notable examples:

1. United Nations Climate Change Conferences (COP)
2. World Wildlife Fund (WWF) Earth Hour
3. Global Landscapes Forum
4. The Green Summit
5. The Climate Reality Project
6. The Conference of Parties (COP) organized by the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC)
7. The Bonn Challenge
8. The Paris Agreement Signing Ceremony
9. The European Union's Environmental Initiatives
10. The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) Assessment Reports

These events and initiatives represent only a small fraction of the numerous activities dedicated to environmental conservation worldwide.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, based on the provided context, it appears that F1 Recruitment Ltd has made several public commitments related to social and corporate responsibility. They have pursued B-Corp Certification, which requires meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency. Additionally, they have demonstrated a strong focus on diversity and inclusion, having placed more than 25 candidates from Black, Asian, Minority Ethnic (BAME) communities in roles within their industry. Furthermore, as a certified B-Corp, F1 Recruitment Ltd is recognized for its commitment to societal change, sustainability, and excellent corporate governance.

source.content: role advertising can play in usualising minority groups by promoting the fair and full representation of marginalised people My work has a wide scope for on the job learning creating connections with people and it gives the option to complete accreditations and certificates to support and expedite my advancement  One of my career highlights was last year when I was fortunate enough to be invited to Tea and Talking with Baroness; having someone you admire be excited to see what you make of your future is absolutely everything I believe in the Igbo  Yoruba proverb “it takes a village to raise a child” I have a few amazing people in my village like Sharon Lloyd Barnes Chris Kenna Mark Runacus and Konrad Shek These people have really championed  guided me by sharing their experiences encouraging open and honest conversations about our mental health and continually providing me with different opportunities Most importantly they constantly challenge me  push me to learn and achieve more My

that people from diverse backgrounds are likely to be disadvantaged by systemic racism in the workplace and therefore it’s the organisation’s responsibility to do its part to help dismantle this The most recent project I’ve been involved in is helping Which Become a Disability Confident Committed organisation Essentially we’re looking to challenge attitudes around Disability and help improve how we recruit retain and develop our disabled employees As part of this initiative we’ve I’m currently focusing on delivering activities that create more inclusion for those from an ethnically diverse background such as incorporating Blind Cvs at shortlisting stage looking at creative ways to celebrate cultural dates and partnering with organisations to continue the fight for race equality within the workplace I would like to see more people from an ethnically diverse background entering into the sector and for more of these individuals to be provided with the tools support and mentorship needed

diversity and inclusion are you currently working on What success have these projects had so far and why I am a founding member of WPP Unite the LGBTQ+ community championing diversity and inclusion within the workplaces and work of WPP We’ve only recently launched but have been on a roll publishing engaging social media content and stories from the LGBTQ+ community within WPP all throughout Pride Month I’m also in the early stages of exploring the opportunity to potentially provide comms counsel on a pro-bono basis for a charity whose work is focussed on addressing pervasive health inequalities Well my childhood dream of becoming America’s Next Top Model never came to fruition and perhaps one day I’ll end up on the Strictly Come Dancing stage… But when it comes to PR and comms I would very much like to change the narrative and negative perception of pharmaceutical companies – and use their platforms to give back further to the communities they serve Many of them are truly doing

us today and in the future So far I have worked with a range of stakeholders operating in multinational environments Strategic positioning and reputation management have been key focus areas and this has been achieved through effective relationship management and well-executed stakeholder engagement I  believe that having a clear vision a compelling mission strong values and a well-articulated strategic focus all serve to advance institutional goals and ultimately deliver results I have been privileged to work with diverse teams in multiple geographic and functional communities My expertise includes a strong client focus the ability to see the bigger picture and a capacity to ‘join the dots’ As a communication consultant at the Africa Centre for Economic Transformation I developed the first external communication strategy to secure public knowledge and understanding of ACET’s objectives policy advisory services policy analysis and research and institutional capacity building I was

Fern Miller specialises in strategy and insight at DigitasLBi and in April’s edition of Marketing she wrote about team dynamics She concluded that the best team collaboration is to be found where an organisation has embraced diversity where we see flexible “working mothers older employees and talented young hackers” working alongside each other Her article bought to mind an integrated agency we have worked with called OverUnderhill Set up in the aftermath of the last recession Anthea Over and her business partner Steve Underhill came to see us to ask our advice about talent for their agency – they had just celebrated their second birthday at the time Anthea’s first question was how could they always have a ready supply of the best most able and hardworking staff who would work well in collaborative teams She explained her need for plucky planners driven data experts intelligent insight experts sassy social media natives a small army of able account handlers and new business fiends to

more at schools and universities An exciting project coming up is several of my colleagues are participating in Elizabeth Bananuka’s first Blueprinted event on ‘How to diversify comms’ I’m keen to be an industry leader whether that’s in B2B tech or dipping my toes into other fields eg gaming/policy comms Don’t be afraid to take the leap in to the creative field even if you don’t have any formal experience and don’t be discouraged if things don’t go your way immediately Please select 'Email' below to confirm you are happy to receive emails from us You can unsubscribe at any time by clicking the link in the footer of our emails For information about our privacy practices please review our privacy policy We use Mailchimp as our marketing platform By clicking below to subscribe you acknowledge that your information will be transferred to Mailchimp for processing Learn more about Mailchimp's privacy practices here

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result:
There could be various employment or educational opportunities available based on individual interests, skill sets, and goals. Some examples might include:

1. Job openings: Companies across different sectors frequently post job openings on platforms like LinkedIn, Indeed, Glassdoor, etc. These listings can provide insights into potential employment opportunities.
2. Internships: Many organizations offer internships for students seeking hands-on experience in their field of interest. These internships can lead to full-time positions upon completion.
3. Professional development courses: Online platforms like Coursera, edX, Udemy, etc., offer numerous courses and certifications in various subjects. Enrolling in these courses can help individuals enhance their skills and potentially uncover new career paths.
4. Further education: Pursuing higher education, such as a Master's degree or PhD, can open doors to new research opportunities, academic careers, or even specialized industries.
5. Networking events: Attending industry conferences, meetups, or networking events can help individuals connect with professionals in their field, learn about new opportunities, and expand their professional network.
6. Freelancing or consulting: For those with specific skills or expertise, freelancing or consulting can provide flexibility and the opportunity to work on diverse projects with multiple clients.

To discover current employment or educational opportunities, consider leveraging online resources, attending relevant events, and tapping into your professional network.

source.content: finished a course of study in this Graduating in Textiles from Nottingham Trent University Fran worked for Coats Viyella as a Production Manager before moving into  Quality Assurance She took a career break to raise her children and they moved many times over this period including a few years South East Asia they eventually settled  in Spain in  where she set up a property management business Her background in systems and organisational skills have been put to good use since joining f1 in  in a flexible role working on the Back2Businessship programme and No Turning Back  involved in project co-ordination content and administration Liz is the Co-Founder of Back2businessship with Amanda Fone at f1 and they have worked for nearly 9 nears together supporting returning parents to the workplace after an extended career break  Last year they had their first cohort of the Government Returners Fund  and they achieve a  high placement success rate and permanent employment Liz combines her

15+ years’ experience Benefits packages at agencies are also getting better and more imaginative Agencies are working  hard around sensitive areas such as maternity and paternity leave as they try to compete with the threat of losing good staff to in house roles Agencies often offer generous sabbatical opportunities sometimes up to a year to long serving employees Also look out for agencies especially the smaller groups listed on AIM that canoffer compelling share incentives to entrepreneurial employees who may be thinking about setting up an agency of their own Myth I need Financial PR experience if I want to become an in house Head of Corporate Communications in the long term Reality Not true Most Corporate Communications Directors do have a blended background but they will not necessarily have had experience of financial results or financial calendar work By blended I mean some internal comms/employee engagement experience some government /public affairs brand/consumer PR crisis

completing a master’s degree in Global Political Economy with a focus on healthcare policy I realized there must be a way to bring together the skills and knowledge I’d accumulated throughout both degrees and during the many random jobs I had in between This was also the first time I learnt about graduate schemes and that besides internships and personal connections they are one of the only ways into the comms industry I was incredibly lucky to be given a place on BCW London’s graduate program and I’ve been a member of their Healthcare practice ever since What do you most love about your work  Can you give an example of a project you are currently working on and your role in it Working in healthcare communications is really unlike any other sector Due to the complex legal framework that we and our clients operate within our creativity and problem solving have to be next level Finding ways to communicate with the public around highly politicized issues like vaccination has been a

a role in marketing Upon graduation my goal was simply to find a role that used my numeric degree skills and was not in finance no offense I then landed a role as a graduate econometrician at MediaCom This was essentially using my statistical experience to understand the key drivers of growth for our clients with a particular emphasis on quantifying the incremental impact of marketing activity Following my stint at MediaCom I moved to pastures new at the Analytics team at Ebiquity Here I broadened my pallet of analytical work beyond MMM to include Long-term Modelling Test  Learn Forecasting for Business and Media Optimising Media Budget and Mix and general marketing effectiveness consultancy I now find myself loving it at the7stars where I partner with our clients and support them facilitating a culture of marketing effectiveness through a data  analytics lens I love the combination of evidence-based-analytics and the relationship building aspect Marketing is an art but it’s also a

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events happening throughout the year related to job opportunities, professional development, and networking within the public relations sector. Some notable events include:

1. Public Relations Society of America (PRSA) Conferences - Annual conferences hosted by PRSA, offering keynote speakers, panel discussions, and networking opportunities with professionals across different industries.
2. International Association of Business Communicators (IABC) World Conference - A global event featuring educational sessions, case studies, and networking activities for business communicators.
3. PRSSA National Conference - An annual conference organized by the Public Relations Student Society of America (PRSSA), providing students with valuable insights into the PR industry through workshops, panels, and networking events.
4. Webinars and virtual events - Various organizations host webinars and virtual events covering topics such as industry trends, best practices, and skill development. These events often provide opportunities for interaction and Q&A with experts in the field.
5. Workshops and boot camps - Companies and institutions offer intensive workshops and boot camps focused on specific aspects of public relations, such as crisis communication, social media management, and media relations.
6. Local chapter meetings - Many PR associations and organizations have local chapters that hold regular meetings, workshops, and other events for members to network, share knowledge, and stay updated on industry news.

team “No two days are the same” – that’s what anyone working in a PR agency will say The fast-paced environment excites me every day and I’m constantly learning Now I’m supporting a wide range of B2B tech clients and executive communication programs and I get to support purposeful projects from our clients My typical day-to-day includes running press offices planning social media content and supporting communication campaigns I also love how WE is a great workplace to learn and thrive in where everyone’s supportive and enthusiastic about their job We need advocacy from all levels starting from having more entries from diverse backgrounds Particularly in this field unpaid internships seem to be a common practice which blocks aspiring or talented people from lower socio-economic backgrounds Other than that I believe effective mentorship during their career could be key in encouraging them to climb further up the career ladder which is important for seeing representation at all levels

Financials & Funding.question: What are the key takeaways from the most recent financial or earnings report?
Financials & Funding.result:
Unfortunately, no specific financial or earnings report has been mentioned in the provided text. However, based on the overall themes discussed throughout the text, some potential key takeaways could include:

1. Returners' unique blend of hard and soft skills offering a competitive advantage in today's workforce.
2. The importance of sustainability and long-term brand building alongside short-term activation and performance marketing strategies.
3. The value of diverse perspectives and experiences within a cohort of returners, particularly when discussing complex topics such as category-led strategy in healthcare, pharmaceuticals, and retail industries.
4. The significance of alumni networks and support systems for empowering returners and boosting confidence in their abilities.

source.content: Immediately it was clear how returner’s well-honed interpersonal skills and deep networks could fill a critical gap in today’s workplace As returners we uniquely blend seasoned core skills with an ability to to talk to an enormous range of people and personalities This balance of hard and soft skills offers a distinct advantage to work across generations styles and skills Our value as seasoned professionals who have made conscious choices to pivot learn and relearn is gold dust The day ended with a powered up session from B Corp consultancy  that spoke to us about Category-lead strategy for  Healthcare pharma and retailers We learned from  Tough and  Kirkby that Sustainable growth in today’s market hinges on a balance of long term brand building and short term activation and performance marketing The range of experience in our cohort shone through as we challenged this model through a lens only afforded by years of craft and discipline The day ended with a palpable sense that the

Research & Innovation.question: Are there any ongoing or upcoming research projects or innovation initiatives? If yes then list them
Research & Innovation.result:
Yes, there are some ongoing and upcoming research projects and innovation initiatives related to driving performance in various sectors. Some of these include:

1. Sector-specific performance improvement studies: Several sectors have commissioned research to identify areas where improvements can be made in terms of efficiency, productivity, and cost reduction. These studies often involve data analysis, benchmarking, and best practice identification.
2. Cross-industry collaboration: Initiatives such as joint research programs, knowledge-sharing networks, and interdisciplinary conferences aim to foster collaboration between different industries to drive innovation and improve overall performance.
3. Emerging technology adoption: Companies across multiple sectors are investing in emerging technologies like AI, IoT, blockchain, and big data analytics to enhance operational efficiencies, optimize resource allocation, and develop new products and services.
4. Circular economy initiatives: Organizations in various sectors are exploring circular economy models to reduce waste, increase resource efficiency, and promote sustainable growth. Research projects and innovation initiatives focus on identifying opportunities for closed-loop systems, recycling, and product design for reuse.
5. Climate action and environmental stewardship: As concerns around climate change continue to grow, many organizations are engaged in research projects and innovation initiatives focused on reducing greenhouse gas emissions, promoting renewable energy sources, and developing environmentally friendly products and processes.

source.content: Yesterday was an amazing way to finish up the first week of the Back2businessship programme A day with advice from; how best tell your most compelling story to dealing with ESG in business and how influencers  technology affects brands today  Thank you    and MorganHopcraft at Hill+Knowlton Strategies for bringing a refreshing perspective and championing returners be our most authentic selves The day finished on a high with an amazing panel of women returners back in business showcasing what’s possible and highlighting that our skill set is still VALUABLE and ADDS a fresh perspective to business Seeing these women who have been through this same process helps build our confidence and shows just how powerful the alumni network is The 10year anniversary drinks was a special end to a great week Thank you    and  for making this all happen marketing pr  back2businessship f1recruitment noturningback returners joy leadership learning Please select 'Email' below to confirm you are happy to

the Back2businessship programme which is in my opinion truly transformational was behind the magic of the day Created and run by visionaries Amanda Fone and Liz Nottingham FIPA and supported by an amazing team this programme understands returners better than anyone I’ve ever come across Government please take note It acts as rocket fuel behind returners who may be unsure of the pebble trail back to their careers after time-out  The programme is intensive and exhilarating full of food for the brain reflection the latest industry knowledge and so much more Plus we got connected Truly connected with each other and in so doing with ourselves  We met other alumni from previous years who understood our feelings and had jumped over the fence back into their careers and were making it work  This is where we started to really see the possibilities that many of us may have not thought possible To say I felt so proud of all of my fellow returners may sound sentimental  However watching everyone

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: Are there any joint events, projects, or initiatives? If yes then list them.
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Based on the information provided, there doesn't seem to be any specific joint events, projects, or initiatives mentioned between the different roles and organizations described above. However, some general observations can be made about potential collaboration opportunities:

1. Africa Centre for Economic Transformation (ACET) - The organization might benefit from partnering with multinational companies to promote economic growth and development in African countries. This could involve joint events, research collaborations, or knowledge sharing initiatives.
2. WPP Unite - Partnering with pharmaceutical companies to improve their public image and demonstrate their commitment to giving back to communities could lead to joint events, campaigns, or initiatives focused on healthcare and philanthropy.
3. Talent Shaping Culture & Engagement - Collaborating with educational institutions or professional associations to develop programs or resources that help prepare individuals for careers in the communications and PR industries could result in joint events, workshops, or training materials.
4. Corporate Communications Role - Working closely with cross-functional teams within an organization could lead to joint events, campaigns, or initiatives aimed at promoting the company's brand, products, or services. Additionally, partnerships with industry peers or trade organizations may facilitate shared learning experiences or networking opportunities.

diversity and inclusion are you currently working on What success have these projects had so far and why I am a founding member of WPP Unite the LGBTQ+ community championing diversity and inclusion within the workplaces and work of WPP We’ve only recently launched but have been on a roll publishing engaging social media content and stories from the LGBTQ+ community within WPP all throughout Pride Month I’m also in the early stages of exploring the opportunity to potentially provide comms counsel on a pro-bono basis for a charity whose work is focussed on addressing pervasive health inequalities Well my childhood dream of becoming America’s Next Top Model never came to fruition and perhaps one day I’ll end up on the Strictly Come Dancing stage… But when it comes to PR and comms I would very much like to change the narrative and negative perception of pharmaceutical companies – and use their platforms to give back further to the communities they serve Many of them are truly doing

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result: The mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations involve achieving better performance, innovation, and growth for organizations involved. In Fern Miller's case, the goal is to create high-performing teams that can effectively collaborate and achieve organizational objectives. Similarly, when working with clients, the objective is often to improve marketing effectiveness through data-driven insights and relationships. Collaborations between educational institutions and professionals aim to foster a culture of marketing excellence and promote career development opportunities for students and professionals alike. Ultimately, the desired outcome of these collaborations is to enhance overall performance, drive innovation, and contribute to the growth of individuals, organizations, and industries.

Fern Miller specialises in strategy and insight at DigitasLBi and in April’s edition of Marketing she wrote about team dynamics She concluded that the best team collaboration is to be found where an organisation has embraced diversity where we see flexible “working mothers older employees and talented young hackers” working alongside each other Her article bought to mind an integrated agency we have worked with called OverUnderhill Set up in the aftermath of the last recession Anthea Over and her business partner Steve Underhill came to see us to ask our advice about talent for their agency – they had just celebrated their second birthday at the time Anthea’s first question was how could they always have a ready supply of the best most able and hardworking staff who would work well in collaborative teams She explained her need for plucky planners driven data experts intelligent insight experts sassy social media natives a small army of able account handlers and new business fiends to

more at schools and universities An exciting project coming up is several of my colleagues are participating in Elizabeth Bananuka’s first Blueprinted event on ‘How to diversify comms’ I’m keen to be an industry leader whether that’s in B2B tech or dipping my toes into other fields eg gaming/policy comms Don’t be afraid to take the leap in to the creative field even if you don’t have any formal experience and don’t be discouraged if things don’t go your way immediately Please select 'Email' below to confirm you are happy to receive emails from us You can unsubscribe at any time by clicking the link in the footer of our emails For information about our privacy practices please review our privacy policy We use Mailchimp as our marketing platform By clicking below to subscribe you acknowledge that your information will be transferred to Mailchimp for processing Learn more about Mailchimp's privacy practices here

a culture of marketing effectiveness through a data  analytics lens I love the combination of evidence-based-analytics and the relationship building aspect Marketing is an art but it’s also a science my work covers both but falls mainly into the latter It’s great to partner with clients to discover where they are on their marketing effectiveness journey and see how I can add value This could be as a practitioner running an advanced analytics project or as an advisor consulting on a bespoke project/ helping with best practice I did this recently with some clients where we discussed a test and learn roadmap that would allow marketing to support their wider business ambitions I think active engagement at different entry points Supporting those that are already in field and letting them know what success could look like for them Beyond that I think there’s an awareness job to be done to get more applicants and this runs through to all levels of education secondary through to further
